item.title: setAnimation, startAnimation, under process
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

	public void setAnimation(int i) {
		//pEmote = i;
		//updateRequired = true;
		//appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
		startAnimation(i);
	}

	public void resetAnimation() {
		pEmote = playerSE;
		updateRequired = true;
		appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
	}

Oh btw, i have to keep it quoted, other wise, my weapon emotes go HELLA fast. =-(…

item.title: setAnimation, startAnimation, under process
item.dc:creator: @Rudolph Rudolph
item.description:
@Rudolph wrote:

If you have the resetAnimation method, then use it 

resetAnimation();

And you should have it btw, unless your server source is really abnormal.

item.title: setAnimation, startAnimation, under process
item.dc:creator: @Aff Aff
item.description:
@Aff wrote:

Replace yours with this:

public void setAnimation(int i) { pEmote = i; updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; startAnimation(i); }

item.title: setAnimation, startAnimation, under process
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

I got a reply from “Dell” saying, my emotes, that i put in handlers, aren’t working properly because my setAnimation, and startAnimation methods, aren’t under process.

E.G:

p.setAnimation(#);

Now, i tried to delete setAnimation, and add it underneath process, boolean process.

	public void setAnimation(int i) {
		//pEmote = i;
		//updateRequired = true;
		//appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
		startAnimation(i);
	}

And i get 100 errors. Can someone explain why? And why my emotes aren’t working properly?

Thx

-XJKX

Read full topic
